hedline.hl1: AT&T to Begin New Image Campaign

abstract.p: AT&T Corp, reflecting efforts to transform company from focus on long distance to broadband services, begins its first corporate image campaign in about two years; budget for campaign is estimated at $50 million; new theme, 'Boundless,' replaces most recent previous theme, 'It's all within your reach'; campaign is being created by FCB Worldwide and Young & Rubicam (S)

block.p: Reflecting efforts to transform the company from a focus on long distance to broadband services, AT&T begins its first corporate image campaign in about two years today. The budget for the campaign was estimated at $50 million.

A new theme, ''Boundless,'' replaces the most recent previous theme, ''It's all within your reach.'' In television commercials and print advertisements, the AT&T insignia globe logo is recreated as an oversized, three-dimensional object.

Reflecting efforts to transform the company from a focus on long distance to broadband services, AT&T begins its first corporate image campaign in about two years today. The budget for the campaign was estimated at $50 million.

A new theme, ''Boundless,'' replaces the most recent previous theme, ''It's all within your reach.'' In television commercials and print advertisements, the AT&T insignia globe logo is recreated as an oversized, three-dimensional object.
''We're really trying to change perceptions of the AT&T brand amongst all adults and to revitalize the brand,'' said Dick Martin, executive vice president at AT&T in Basking Ridge, N.J.
AT& T has been traditionally viewed as ''trustworthy, reliable, prestigious, established,'' he added. ''What we are not seen as being is dynamic, visionary, fast-moving, different, fun.''

The campaign is being created by the two main AT&T roster agencies, the New York offices of FCB Worldwide, part of True North Communications, and Young & Rubicam Advertising; the ''It's all within your reach'' campaign had been created by Y.& R. Advertising. AT&T sought ideas from both agencies and decided last month that they should collaborate on the ''Boundless'' campaign. The commercials are by Y.& R and the print ads are by FCB.
